page.title: 06THE CHURCH OF ST. FRANCIS
page.content: This modern church was built in 1978 and extended in 1982. On a usual Sunday there is a congregation of about 90 people of whom 70 take communion. On a Parade Day up to 250 people attend services. The church is shared by the{Methodists and the {United Reform Church.}The vicar,the Reverend Peter Stell, holds joint services. The church is also used for Sunday School,church council meetings, Diocese meetings and can be booked for other meetings and coffee mornings. The scouts,cubs,guides and brownies also use the church. The church is designed for flexible use. The furniture can be easily moved around and the hall separated into several parts. There is a kitchen with a fridge,cooker,cupboard and 2 kettle In the vestry is a safe for keeping the silver in.
